post.description: Use this endpoint to Attach an existing payment method to a buyer.

200.description: The payment method you've just attached to buyer.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.
errors: The buyer_id you provided does not correspond to any buyer account.

value.message: The requested resource cannot be found.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new payment method.

201.description: The payment method you have just created.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.

get.description: Use this endpoint to list all your payment methods.

200.description: A list of your payment methods.

post.description: Use this endpoint to detach an existing payment method from a buyer.

200.description: The payment method you've just detached from buyer.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.
errors: There is not a buyer to detach from.

value.message: The requested resource cannot be found.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve an existing payment method.

200.description: The payment method with the ID you provided.

value.message: The requested resource cannot be found.

post.description: Use this endpoint to update an existing payment method.

200.description: The payment method you have just updated.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.
The requested resource cannot be found.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new buyer profile.

201.description: The buyer you have just created.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.

get.description: Use this endpoint to list all your buyers.

delete.description: Use this endpoint to delete an existing buyer profile.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.
errors: Cannot delete buyer with attached methods.

value.message: The requested resource cannot be found.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve an existing buyer profile.

200.description: The buyer with the ID you provided.

value.message: The requested resource cannot be found.

post.description: Use this endpoint to update an existing buyer profile.

200.description: The buyer you have just updated.

400.description: The request did not pass validation checks.

value.message: One or more validation error occurred.
The requested resource cannot be found.

buyer_id.description: ID of the buyer associated with this payment method, if exists.

BillingDetailsContract.description: Billing information associated with the PaymentMethod that may be used or required by particular types of payment methods.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

CardContract.description: If this is a card payment method, this hash contains the buyer’s card details.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the card.

exp_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

exp_year.description: Four-digit number representing the card’s expiration year.

country.description: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you’ve collected.

BankContract.description: If this is a bank payment method, this hash contains details about the bank account.

country.description: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

MetadataContract.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

buyer_id.description: The ID of the buyer to which to attach the PaymentMethod.

BillingDetailsOptions.description: Billing information associated with the PaymentMethod that may be used or required by particular types of payment methods.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

CreateCardOptions.description: If this is a card PaymentMethod, this hash contains the user’s card details. When providing a card number, you must meet the requirements for PCI compliance. We strongly recommend using BIOS.js instead of interacting with this API directly.

number.description: The card number, as a string without any separators.

cvc.description: Card security code. It is highly recommended to always include this value.

expMonth.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

expYear.description: Four-digit number representing the card’s expiration year.

BankOptions.description: If this is a bank payment method, this hash contains details about the bank account.

name.description: The buyer’s bank name. This parameter can be required with some payment method types.

country.description: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in. This parameter can be required with some payment method types.

MetadataOptions.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

UpdateCardOptions.description: If this is a card PaymentMethod, this hash contains the user’s card details.

expMonth.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

expYear.description: Four-digit number representing the card’s expiration year.

EmptyResponse.description: a response dto that doesn't have any properties
